series.series.name: Women Shouldn't Pay Price for Promise Keepers

abstract.p: Louise Detwiller letter on Laura Ingraham's July 10 article on National Organization for Women's opposition to Promise Keepers (S)

block.p: The sideshow that is Promise Keepers flaunts the age-old doctrine of authority based on biology (Op-Ed, July 10). Good intentions aside, this rigid social arrangement harms all of us, men and women alike. The tears that are shed on Promise Keepers stages are, paradoxically, the result of the same emotions negated by the traditional male role. Family integration is preached, yet wives and daughters are checked at the door with the coats.

The sideshow that is Promise Keepers flaunts the age-old doctrine of authority based on biology (Op-Ed, July 10). Good intentions aside, this rigid social arrangement harms all of us, men and women alike. The tears that are shed on Promise Keepers stages are, paradoxically, the result of the same emotions negated by the traditional male role. Family integration is preached, yet wives and daughters are checked at the door with the coats.

The victims of Promise Keepers participate in their own demise by jumping at the chance to be ''real men.'' How can this prepackaged mold create better individuals when by definition it suppresses all that is individual?
No wonder the stadiums are filling up with crying men. It's an impossible formula that has failed miserably for both sexes.
Women Shouldn't Pay Price for Promise Keepers
